subject: Business
title: The Power of Starting Early
description: A 60-second lesson on The Power of Starting Early.

hook.text: Alice invests $200/month from age 25 to 35 and stops. Bob invests $200/month from age 35 to 65. Alice ends with more.

buildup.text: Starting early gives compound interest more time to work. Each extra year at the beginning matters enormously.

discovery.text: Alice invested $24,000 total. Bob invested $72,000 total. But Alice's 10 extra years of compounding beat Bob's 30 years.

twist.text: Young people often say they'll invest 'later when they earn more.' But delaying 10 years can cost $500,000+ by.

climax.text: The best financial decision a 22-year-old can make isn't a high salary. It's investing consistently from day one.

punchline.text: The best time to invest was yesterday. The second best time is today.

quiz.question: Why does Alice end up wealthier despite investing less money than Bob?
options: Her 10 extra years of compounding outweigh Bob's larger total contributions
